There is no vaccine. Ribavirin is an effective treatment if taken early.
82

Infection is acquired through contact with an infected rodent, but person-to-person transmission is possible (R0 was 1.06–1.62 in Nigeria, 2018).
83 Lab infections exist.
The virus is endemic in West Africa, with 100,000–300,000 cases per year, 84 of which 15% are severe (of these, 25% of cases are deaf if they survive).

With respect to mortality, 5,000 deaths are recorded each year worldwide.
83
Occupational concentration occurs in health care workers.
The disease is not present in Europe.
